headline: World water day  in pictures
text: A fisherman sails on the sea around Cartagena de Indias, Colombia Photograph: Ricardo Maldonado Rozo/EPA       A Nepalese woman collects fresh water while carrying her son on her back in Patan Photograph: Narenda Shrestha/EPA       Two men walk under the splashing water in Kuala Lumpur's KLCC water park.Photograph: Khairil Safwan/Demotix/Corbis       Women carry drinking water from a tank in Dhaka, Bangladesh Photograph: ABIR ABDULLAH/EPA       A school boy drinks water from a leaking pipe on the outskirts of Srinagar in Kashmir Photograph: FAROOQ KHAN/EPA       Girls carry water in Lahore, PakistanPhotograph: Jamil Ahmed/Xinhua Press/Corbis       Water is transported by bicycle in Lahore, Pakistan. According to the World Bank, about 70% of the Pakistani population does not have access to safe drinking waterPhotograph: Jamil Ahmed/Xinhua Press/Corbis       Boys carry their water tanks as they run to fill drinking water at a distribution point in Quetta, south-west PakistanPhotograph: Iqbal Hussain/Xinhua Press/Corbis       Bottles of potable water are stacked for distribution in Colombo, Sri Lanka. The country is blessed with ample water but certain overpopulated areas still confront a dearth of adequate water supplyPhotograph: M A Pushpa Kumara/EPA       Women fill containers with drinking water from a government tanker in Hyderabad Photograph: NOAH SEELAM/AFP/Getty Images       A boy carries a stainless steel pot filled with drinking water through a narrow lane in a fisherman colony in Mumbai, India Photograph: PUNIT PARANJPE/AFP/Getty Images       Water is collected in cans in the Mathare slum in Nairobi, KenyaPhotograph: Tony Karumba/AFP/Getty Images       A woman fishes in Lake ILopango in the town of Joya Grande, south of San Salvador. The polluted ILopango lake is the main water source of Salvador's capital Photograph: JOSE CABEZAS/AFP/Getty Images       Residents of Rio de Janeiro collect rubbish on Copacabana beach Photograph: SERGIO MORAES/REUTERS       A man exits a shop selling water in Monterey Park, CaliforniaPhotograph: Frederic J Brown/AFP/Getty Images       A woman bathes her child on Lake Cocibolca in Nicaragua. The lake, with an area of 3,166 square miles, is the biggest in the country Photograph: OSWALDO RIVAS/REUTERS       A fisherman casts a net over the waters of Lake Cocibolca in Nicaragua Photograph: OSWALDO RIVAS/REUTERS       Greenpeace activists kayak in front of the Juanacatln Falls in Mexico. The waters have become heavily polluted by industry Photograph: Ulises Ruiz Basurto/EPA       A dead fish lies on the cracked earth of the drought-stricken La Sorrueda reservoir near Santa Lucia village in Gran Canaria Photograph: BORJA SUAREZ/REUTERS
